title: Variable Selection: Bayesian Model Averaging
text:
What This Section Accomplishes: BMA systematically evaluates which variables should be included in the final spatial model by considering all possible combinations and weighting them by statistical evidence. This handles model uncertainty inherent in complex social processes.

Codelibrary(BMA)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)

# Your BMA setup code here

title: Spatial Capabilities and Community Corrections
text:
This interactive tutorial demonstrates how to integrate spatial capabilities theory with Integrated Nested Laplace Approximation (INLA) methodology.





Complete workflow from data preparation through spatial modeling:

Data Preparation - Cleaning and integration
Variable Selection - Bayesian Model Averaging

Spatial Modeling - INLA-BYM2 implementation
Model Validation - Diagnostics and testing




Analysis results and policy translation:

Results - Key findings and spatial patterns
Policy Applications - Evidence-based recommendations
About - Background and context












Ready to Begin?



Start with Data Preparation to see the complete workflow, or jump to any section using the navigation menu.

title: Spatial Modeling with INLA-BYM2
text:
What This Section Accomplishes: The INLA-BYM2 framework operationalizes spatial capabilities theory through hierarchical Bayesian structure that decomposes spatial variation into theoretically meaningful components.

Codelibrary(INLA)
library(sf)
library(spdep)

# Your INLA setup code here
